intro: Eriostemon beckleri, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a member of the Asphodelaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its tall, erect stems and long, strap-like leaves. The plant is native to New Zealand and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters at the top of the stems. Eriostemon beckleri is often used in traditional Māori weaving due to its strong, fibrous leaves.
